name: component
description: Creates and defines a component object

params.name: accessors
params.description: If set to true, enables implicit getters and setters for the component's properties. For persistent CFCs, accessors are always enabled.

params.name: synchronized
params.description: If set to true all calls to an instance of a component are synchronized. This setting allows a method to be executed only by one single thread at a time.

params.name: persistent
params.description: Specifies CFC is persistent or not

params.name: extends
params.description: Name of parent component from which to inherit methods and properties.

params.name: implements
params.description: Lists the interfaces that the component implements, specifying the set of functions that the component must provide.

params.name: modifier
params.description: Defines the type of component: `none` for a regular component, `abstract` for a component that cannot be instantiated directly and must be extended, or `final` for a component that cannot be extended by other components.

params.name: displayname
params.description:
A string to be displayed when using introspection to show
information about the CFC. The information appears on the
heading, following the component name.
If the style attribute is set to document, the displayname
attribute is used as the name of the service element in the WSDL.

params.name: hint
params.description: Text that displays when you use introspection to show information about the CFC. The hint attribute value appears below the component name heading. Use this attribute to describe the purpose of the component.

params.name: output
params.description:
- true: permits component method output
- false: suppresses component method output

params.name: style
params.description: Specifies whether a CFC used for web services uses RPC-encoded style or document-literal style

params.name: namespace
params.description:
Specifies the namespace used in the WSDL when
using the CFC as a document-literal style web service.
If you don't specify this attribute, Lucee
derives the namespace from the CFC class name.
This attribute applies only when style="document".

params.name: serviceportname
params.description:
Specifies the name of the port element in the WSDL.
This attribute applies only when style="document".

params.name: serviceaddress
params.description:
Specifies the SOAP URL of the web service. If you don't specify this attribute, Lucee uses the URL of the CFC in the WSDL service description.
Use this attribute to specify the protocol, for example, by specifying a URL that starts with https://. This attribute applies only for web services.

params.name: porttypename
params.description:
Specifies the name of the porttype element in the WSDL.
This attribute applies only when style="document".

params.name: bindingname
params.description:
Specifies the name of the binding element in the WSDL.
This attribute applies only when style="document".

params.name: wsdlfile
params.description:
A properly formatted WSDL file to be used instead of
WSDL generated by Lucee.
This attribute applies only when style="document".

params.name: alias
params.description: Defines an alternative name or alias for the component, providing flexibility in referencing the component in different contexts.

params.name: mappedsuperclass
params.description: Indicates whether the component acts as a mapped superclass. A mapped superclass serves as a base class for other components to extend but does not itself represent a database entity.
